title: Sri Lanka’s main opposition SJB joins boycott of all-party conference on economic crisis
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s main opposition the Samagi Jana Balavegaya will also be boycotting an all-party conference called by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on the country’s worsening economic crisis.

SJB MP Tissa Attanayake told the privately owned NewsFirst network Monday (21) afternoon that the SJB will not be taking part in the conference as the government has repeatedly failed to do its job with respect to managing the economy.

“This all-party conference is an attempt at a media circus and further deception of the public,” Attanayake said, adding that party leaders representing an SJB-led alliance has decided to not attend the meeting.
The opposition National People’s Power (NPP) and a number of parties that represent that ruling Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP)-led coalition have also announced a boycott.
Several govt, opposition parties to boycott all party conference on Sri Lanka economic crisis

Sri Lanka is currently going through one of the worst economic crises in the country’s history, with people queuing up for essentials including fuel, cooking gas and milk powder as the country’s foreign exchange reserves continue to plummet. Daily power outages and skyrocketing cost of living has forced many people to organise their own protests, independent of political parties. Four people have died while waiting in queues for fuel.
